I tried to deploy code to the roboRio, but the error I got was:
PermissionError: [Errno 13] Permission denied: ‘C:\Users\frc96\NTUSER.DAT’
Please help

That sounds like a Windows issue with the user profile. Most of the search results for that error I find online talk about either creating a new user or doing a Windows Repair install to fix it:

https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/forum/all/broken-security-permissions-for-ntuserdat/b7b18703-19eb-4f1a-8e7e-dfbde50b887a

https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/forum/all/access-denied-to-ntuserdat-file/4d20916f-2077-43c5-9353-99f3f21a57c2

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-23T05:51:55.286Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":101,"readers_count":100,"score":50.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":492749,"topic_slug":"roborio-deployment-help","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/forum/all/broken-security-permissions-for-ntuserdat/b7b18703-19eb-4f1a-8e7e-dfbde50b887a","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Redirecting","clicks":1},{"url":"https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/forum/all/access-denied-to-ntuserdat-file/4d20916f-2077-43c5-9353-99f3f21a57c2","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Redirecting","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-deployment-help/492749/2","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3537670,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-24T02:58:35.593Z","cooked":"

If I were to guess, you are running robotpy deploy directly from your user directory? Don’t do that.

When you open a terminal to run robotpy deploy, you need to change directory to the directory that your code is located in. It will only work properly if the current directory is the directory that robot.py is located in. If you happened to put robot.py in your home directory, make a new folder somewhere and put the code there instead.

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

Programming your Radio

This guide will show you how to do a basic setup for controlling your robot “at home” using the VH-109 FRC ® Radio. For complete documentation and information please see the Vivid-Hosting radio sit...

I did everything in that, the radio is broadcasting an access point, but it is not transmitting any data to the driver station.

Try and ping the roborio. It should be at 10.xx.xx.2

How do you ping the roboRio?

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-28T19:32:18.273Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":32,"readers_count":31,"score":16.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":492749,"topic_slug":"roborio-deployment-help","display_username":"Brayden Durocher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":63767,"username":"Sam948","name":"Sam","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sam948/{size}/261363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":73288,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-deployment-help/492749/9","custom_user_title":"Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3543731,"name":"","username":"crueter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-28T19:39:24.737Z","cooked":"

Open a terminal and type ping 10.xx.xx.2 and hit Enter. Replace the xx.xx with your team number, in your case, 10.96.99.2

(while connected to the radio wifi)

So, when I try to deploy code to the roboRio, this is the output:

Screenshot 2025-03-11 1735561453×608 21.2 KB

I don’t know what to do, please help!

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-03-12T00:31:43.646Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":23,"readers_count":22,"score":14.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":492749,"topic_slug":"roborio-deployment-help","display_username":"Brayden Durocher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":73288,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-deployment-help/492749/11","custom_user_title":"Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3554668,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-12T00:36:14.041Z","cooked":"

That error is it trying to load pyproject.toml, and there’s an unclosed array in that file at line 32, column 5. You need to edit that file to fix the syntax error.

The error message isn’t great in that it doesn’t tell you what file it’s reading.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-03-12T00:37:46.237Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":19,"readers_count":18,"score":8.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":492749,"topic_slug":"roborio-deployment-help","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":73288,"username":"Bray500000","name":"Brayden Durocher","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/90db22/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-deployment-help/492749/12","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3554671,"name":"Brayden Durocher","username":"Bray500000","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/90db22/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-12T00:38:45.681Z","cooked":"

You may think I’m dumb, but what is an array?

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-03-12T00:38:45.681Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":18,"readers_count":17,"score":8.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":492749,"topic_slug":"roborio-deployment-help","display_username":"Brayden Durocher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":13575,"username":"Peter_Johnson","name":"Peter Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":73288,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/roborio-deployment-help/492749/13","custom_user_title":"Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3554676,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-12T00:39:52.389Z","cooked":"

An array is a list of multiple elements. For the syntax of it in toml, see TOML: English v1.0.0

You’ll need to add a right square bracket (“]”) to close the array.
